citation.article-title: Bacillus jeotgali sp. nov., isolated from jeotgal, Korean traditional fermented seafood.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Bacillus jeotgali sp. nov.
Bacillus jeotgali ( je.ot.ga'li. N.L. gen. n. jeotgali of jeotgal, Korean traditional food)
Cells are facultatively anaerobic rods that are 0.8-1.1 μm wide and 4.0-6.0 lm long in 24 h culture on TSA­ASW.
Ellipsoidal spores are observed in swollen sporangia.
Gram-variable.
Motile by means of peritrichous flagella.
Colonies are cream-yellow or light orange-yellow coloured, smooth, irregular and flat on TSA­ASW.
See Table 1 for the physiological characteristics.
Grows in the presence of 13% (w/v) NaCl.
No growth occurs in the presence of more than 14% (w/v) NaCl.
Growth occurs at 10 and 45 °C but not at 55 °C.
Optimal growth temperature is 30-35 °C.
Optimal pH for growth is 7.0-8.0.
The growth is inhibited below pH 5.0.
The cell wall peptidoglycan contains meso-diaminopimelic acid.
The predominant menaquinone is MK-7.
The major fatty acid is iso-C15:0.
The G­+C content is 41 mol% (determined by HPLC).
Isolated from Korean traditional fermented seafood, jeotgal.
The type strain is strain YKJ-10T, which has been deposited in the Korean Culture Center of Microorganisms as KCCM 41040T and the Japan Collection of Microorganisms as JCM 10885T.
